intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to create an Authentication Token.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse User perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse User perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Other... and select g-Eclipse (User). Alternatively, click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Select the Authentication Tokens View
item.description: Select the Authentication Tokens tab in the bottom panel view.

item.title: Open the Authentication Token Wizard
item.description:
Open the New Authentication Token wizard by clicking the Click to Perform.
This action bypasses the need to click the New button located in the top right corner of the Authentication Tokens panel view and allows you to continue to follow this cheat sheet while working with the wizard.

item.title: Select the Authentication Token Type
item.description: Choose from the list of available token types and click Next.

item.title: Enter Authentication Information
item.description: Follow these simple steps to create your proxy.

subitem.label: Specify the location of your key and certificate.
If there is no VO available in the list, click the 'New VO' button and specify the required VO information and click 'Finish'.
If you are seeing this, you must have gotten ahead of yourself by opening cheatsheet items without following the wizard.
Select a VOMS Proxy from the list of available VO's.
You will not be able to read the steps unless you restart this cheatsheet and make the selection between Grid and VOMS proxy prior to opening this item.
Adjust how long will the proxy be valid.
Click 'Finish' to create and validate the proxy.

item.title: Activate Your Token
item.description: Highlight your newly created token listed in the Authentication Tokens panel view and click the Activation button.

subitem.label: Click on the token entry to make the activation button (padlock) in the top right part of this panel view visible.
Click this padlock to initiate the activation of your token.
